message: A bit of Mobile Apps Market Predictions. Ahmed Essam Naiem what do you think?
caption: Attachment UnavailableThis attachment may have been removed or the person who shared it may not have permission to share it with you.

data.message:
He is talking about why people are not investing with all of that.

The fact of the matter is, the only thing that move people to do anything is money and it is not in Android.

Even if you use ads the monetization strategy tons of Android users use ads blocker.

Android generally is so poorly developed that same Windows Phone on same hardware is far better than Android (it is huge when u see them side by side)
I would support Android if I own the service, I wouldn't do utility application on Android

i totally agree with you in everything even that Android has the biggest market share comparing to iOS users. iOS still makes a lot more money than android developers. I think it's a culture orientation. iOS users are most likely paying for a product they like or they need Android users crack it :)
Google is taking steps to move Android (Kitkat security...etc) closer to the enterprise and i think it could be a market there for business apps specially that it's now undeserved on that platform.

I don't think it is working very well, the security level still issue with Android.

iOS already passed DoD tests and it is officially usable by most of US government officers 

Anyways, Android got the impression of cheap and it is nearly impossible to change that, many developer managed to make money on Windows Phone more than Android
